item.title: Hong Kong: Chinese ambassador warns UK over 'interference'
item.description: The warning came just after a pro-democracy campaigner asked for more international support.

item.title: Nick Cordero: Broadway actor dies aged 41 of coronavirus complications
item.description: Nick Cordero suffered sepsis infections and mini-strokes and had a leg amputated while in hospital.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Louvre museum reopens after nearly four months
item.description: The Louvre reopens with a one-way system and compulsory masks.

item.title: Suspected drug plane bursts into flames in Mexico after highway landing
item.description: The small jet is engulfed by fire and thick black smoke after the landing in southern Mexico.

item.title: Xu Zhangrun: Outspoken professor detained in China
item.description: Professor Xu Zhangrun was taken from his home by authorities, friends tell the media.

item.title: Huawei: UK government weighs up ban of Chinese firm's telecoms kit
item.description: The National Cyber Security Centre has presented its report into the Chinese firm to government.

item.title: Ryan Adams apologises for 'mistreating' women
item.description: "I will never be off the hook," says the musician, a year after allegations of abuse surfaced.

item.title: Coronavirus: India overtakes Russia in Covid-19 cases
item.description: India has been adding more than 20,000 fresh infections every day for the last four days.

item.title: Coronavirus: Greece bars Serbian visitors as Balkans cases rise
item.description: Athens bars all but essential travel from Serbia for a week as infections steadily rise.

item.title: Bayonne: Bus driver left brain dead after being 'attacked over face masks'
item.description: The driver in France was set upon by people who had no tickets and refused to wear face masks.

item.title: Ennio Morricone: Oscar-winning Italian film composer dies aged 91
item.description: The prolific composer's credits included the "spaghetti" Westerns that made Clint Eastwood a star.

item.title: Body positivity movement: 'Why is my body not important?'
item.description: The body positivity movement has taken over social media and forced the diet industry to reinvent itself, but not all feel included.

item.title: Ennio Morricone: Composer who changed cinema's sound
item.description: The versatile Italian composer's film scores that were an integral part of the cinema experience.

item.title: Coronavirus: Louvre reopens with masks and one-way system
item.description: Masks are compulsory and visitor numbers are restricted at the world's most-visited museum.

item.title: Black Lives Matter in rural England
item.description: Khady Gueye received threats for trying to support Black Lives Matter in rural Gloucestershire.

item.title: Meet the socially distant robot scientist
item.description: While the research labs have been locked down, one robotic scientist has continued experimenting 24/7.

item.title: Sir Elton John honoured by Royal Mint on Â£1,000 gold coin
item.description: The Crocodile Rock singer is the second act to be commemorated in a series of music legends.

item.title: Coronavirus: Records broken at socially distanced hot dog contest
item.description: Safety measures did not put off the champions, who ate 75 and 48.5 hot dogs respectively in 10 minutes.

item.title: Turkish TV: Dramas become a global streaming success
item.description: Online streaming is one of the few industries to enjoy a boom out of lockdown restrictions, and Turkish TV dramas have found great success, reaching audiences all over the world.

item.title: Iran blasts: What is behind mysterious 'attacks' at key sites?
item.description: Fires and blasts have hit sensitive sites in Iran, but is it accidental or sabotage?

item.title: Black Lives Matter: Can viral videos stop police brutality?
item.description: Do viral videos like the one captured of George Floyd's death actually reduce police abuse?

item.title: Working from home: 'I'm a bit brainier than he thought I was'
item.description: What we've learned from watching our other halves work from home during the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: What is bubonic plague?
item.description: Authorities in China have stepped up precautions after a reports of a suspected case.

item.title: Viewpoint: What Donald Trump gets wrong about Somalia
item.description: Somalia has been caught up in the US election campaign thanks to Donald Trump, writes Ismail Einashe.

item.title: The gaming boss who gets addicted to the games
item.description: Andrew Day, the CEO of games developer Keywords Studios, tries not to play the titles himself.

item.title: Coronavirus: How 'three musketeers' helped Georgia fight virus
item.description: Georgia has recorded fewer than 1,000 infections and only 15 deaths among its 3.7 million people.

item.title: The North Korean refugees supplying PPE to care homes
item.description: The North Korean refugees who have donated 7,000 sets of PPE to care homes in the north of England.

item.title: Coronavirus in Singapore: Election campaigning without the handshakes
item.description: Wooing the public typically involves physical interaction, but this vote is a little different.

item.title: 'What hurt me most was being dragged away from my son' - Williams' 'heart hurts' after police stop car
item.description: British sprinter Bianca Williams tells the BBC her "heart hurts" after being stopped by police with her partner.

item.title: Guardiola at a loss to explain Man City defeats
item.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says he is struggling to understand why his side have lost nine Premier League games this season.

item.title: 'I've shown another way to do it' - bulked up DeChambeau powers to win in Detroit
item.description: Bryson DeChambeau's weight gain helped him dominate off the tee and continue his fine recent form at the Rocket Mortgage Classic in Detroit

item.title: Nemanja Matic: Manchester United midfielder signs new contract until 2023
item.description: Manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is "delighted" as midfielder Nemanja Matic extends his deal with Manchester United until the summer of 2023.

item.title: UFC 251: Jorge Masvidal steps in to face champion Kamaru Usman
item.description: Jorge Masvidal takes a title shot at six days' notice as he steps in to face Kamaru Usman at UFC 251.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why surviving the virus may be just the beginning
item.description: For many survivors, waking up in intensive care was only the beginning of a long process of physical and psychological recovery.
